intro.speaker: Girl
intro.line: I found you unconscious on the plains.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: I am Lyn, of the Lorca tribe. You’re safe now. Who are you? Can you remember your name?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Your name is Mark? What an odd-sounding name... But pay me no mind. It is a good name. I see by your attire that you are a traveller. What brings you to the Sacae plains? Would you share your story with me? Hm? What was that noise? I’ll go see what’s happening. Mark, wait here for me.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Oh no! Bandits! They must have come down from the Bern mountains! They must be planning on raiding the local villages. I... I have to stop them! If that’s all of them, I think I can handle them on my own. You’ll be safe in here, Mark.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: What? You want to help? Well, can you use a weapon?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Ah, I see... So you’re a strategist by trade? An odd profession, but... Very well. We’ll go together!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Over here! If you want to help, Mark, I could use your advice. I’ll protect you, so stay close to me.

battle.speaker: Tutorial
battle.line: Lyn gains experience in each encounter. When she has enough experience, she will level up. As she increases in level, her abilities improve. Over time, she will grow much stronger. It’s time to bring this chapter to a close. Select Lyn and move her to the gate where Batta the Beast was standing. Select Seize to complete Lyn’s victory and your own!

battle.speaker: Lyn
battle.line: Good work, Mark! Let’s go home.

boss.speaker: Batta
boss.line: Who do you think you are? You think you can stand up to Batta the Beast?

boss.speaker: Lyn
boss.line: Whew... That was close. I sorely underestimated him. Sorry if I worried you. I’ll need to be stronger if I’m going to survive... Strong enough that no one can defeat me.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Good morning, Mark! Are you awake yet? That fight yesterday must have taken a lot out of you. Say, Mark... I want to talk to you about something. You have some experience in the ways of war, I can see. Would you allow me to travel with you?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: What? You... want me to get permission from my parents?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: My mother and my father... died six months ago. My people—the Lorca—they don’t... I’m the last of my tribe. Bandits attacked, and... they killed so many people. The tribe was shattered. My father was our chieftain, and I tried to protect our people. But I’m so young, and our people were old-fashioned. They wouldn’t follow a woman. No one would follow me. Sniff... I’m sorry. I’ve been alone for so long... No. No more. I will shed no more tears. ... ... ... ...

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Thank you. I’m better now. Mark, I want— I must become stronger, so that I may avenge my father’s death! Yesterday’s battle taught me something. I won’t become stronger by sitting here alone. Mark, tell me you’ll train me, that you’ll let me travel with you!

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: You will? That’s just wonderful! Thank you! Oh, thank you! We’ll be better off working together, I know it. You’ll be my master strategist, and I’ll be your peerless warrior! We can do it! Right?

end.speaker: Tutorial
end.line: Travel with Lyn, Mark. Give her your aid, and master the art of combat. Complete the tasks set out in each chapter, and help Lyn in her quest. Turn the instruction window on or off by pressing SELECT.
